description: The most powerful earthquake ever recorded globally, also known as the Great Chilean Earthquake. It caused widespread devastation and a powerful tsunami that affected the Pacific Rim.
A megathrust earthquake that struck central Chile. It generated a tsunami which devastated several coastal towns and caused significant damage to infrastructure.
A powerful earthquake that triggered a tsunami with waves reaching over 4 meters in some areas. It caused significant damage and led to the evacuation of over a million people.
This earthquake severely damaged Concepción and Talcahuano. Charles Darwin, then on his second voyage on HMS Beagle, witnessed its effects firsthand.
A major earthquake that devastated the city of Valparaíso, causing widespread fires and significant loss of life.
Affected a large area of Central Chile, including Santiago and Valparaíso, causing significant damage and fatalities.
A strong earthquake that caused damage in the Coquimbo and Valparaíso regions, and a small tsunami.
A large earthquake that triggered a small tsunami and caused damage in the northern regions of Chile, leading to mass evacuations.
A destructive earthquake that severely affected the Maule Region, including the city of Talca.
While centered in Peru, this massive earthquake generated a tsunami that also reached and affected the coast of central Chile.
A powerful earthquake and tsunami that devastated Arica (then part of Peru). The tsunami was observed across the Pacific.
A major earthquake that struck the Atacama region and generated a destructive tsunami affecting the Chilean coast and as far as Australia.
Though in Argentina, this quake caused significant damage and was strongly felt in central Chile due to its intensity.
A strong earthquake that caused damage in the Ovalle area and surrounding towns.
A significant earthquake followed by a tsunami that caused damage in Valparaíso and other coastal areas.
